Has anyone had experience integrating an "Apply with LinkedIn" button and their API to a HubSpot page?

<https://developer.linkedin.com/docs/lts/apply-with-linkedin#integrating>
If you can set this response header and the domain supports SSL, you donâ€™t have to change all the links: <https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Upgrade-Insecure-Requests>
above would work, only problem would be if they are linking to an offsite source that does not have an https.
also this has some options: <http://ithemes.com/codex/page/Fix_Non-SSL_Elements_on_SSL_Page>
<@U22PJPGK0> I checked out can I use on that last night and it isn't great....
not myself, but it looks like there's a fairly popular zap: <https://zapier.com/zapbook/linkedin-lead-gen-forms/>
<https://wordpress.org/plugins/ssl-insecure-content-fixer/>
<@U25PYL3Q8>
thanks! I'll look into that for next time
what I ended up doing is downloading search regex
and doing a bunch of regex swaps for the urls in the post_content
yeah that is probably what this does

I had a few small issues where I had to do some specific changes to certain urls because of redirects that were there, and needed to bypass them so I had to take a more custom approach then just doing a straight // switch
I also made a little presentation to share wiht my team
<@U25PYL3Q8> shared a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U25PYL3Q8/F7CLAGW10/_a_journey_into_fixing_mixed_content|To // or to https:// a journey into fixing mixed content>
Stylish.
It is mostly about wordpress sites, but you could do teh same type of stuff using the API with HubSpot pages / blog etc
But informational
and obviously i ruined the to be or not to be
but whatever
it is what it is.
if anyone has feedback, please let me know

General question for all the devs in here:  How does everyone else handle vendor pre-fixing for CSS?

I personally do most of my styling work in .SCSS in Sublime text and run my stylesheets through a gulp task which also runs a localhost server.  I then reference the location of the outputted .CSS file in the localhost in the `<head>` of the project I'm working on and then cut and paste the outputted .CSS into the actual stylesheet hosted within HubSpot.
If you're already using gulp tasks, you can just use HubSpot FTP to upload your file to the code editor directly
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tools/HubSpot-ftp>
That's pretty much what I do
Autoprefixer handles the vendor prefixes, vinyl-ftp handles the upload
oh cool!  I hadn't heard of vinyl-ftp.  I will definitely have to check that out
thanks <@U3A4KEWK1>
I used vinyl-ftp but found it was difficult to keep things working properly and synced properly
I use gulp-autoprefixer
I only use it for uploading, so no syncing
<@U25PYL3Q8> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U25PYL3Q8/F7CNC4XEW/my_current_gulp_file.js|my current gulp file>
If I was on a project by myself I might roll the uploading...

The gulp file I added here is how we keep our stylesheets separate, as the use your mac username to make your production file. I also have some error reporting into the console as well as the notifcation section in top right
I haven't cleared the reset of my node modules out of there because I add them when I need them
but overall-- you don't have to modify and everyone can share and it doesn't matter where their folders are on their drive
Ive had some other things in here to notify hipchat and slack but theya ren't in this one
nice!  Thanks for sharing <@U25PYL3Q8>
I've done quite a bit of other work with gulp stuff, but this is what we are rolling with our base right now

So I know this was asked somewhere (just tried searching and cant find it) but there are services out there like Databox and more that can connect to HubSpot and pull analytical data. Is there an API out there to connect to that can pull this info?
I think <@U25EHAP7G> is using Databox? Maybe he has some insight?
Yea, i've tested it out and I am trying to see if I can pull the same stats in Google's DataStudio using an api
This post was where I saw this originally <https://integrate.HubSpot.com/t/retrieving-sources-report-data-via-HubSpot-api/5379/3>
It seems like HubSpot's page cache isn't getting flushed when I make up updates. Is anyone else seeing that?
I made some updates to a site header and they're not showing up
On the home page, anyway, but on other pages that I visited after making the update they are showing up
are you doing hard refresh? when this happens and it is a css change, I erase everything in file, save blank, refresh live page, paste in css, resave, then refresh live page
same goes for anything coded...  the generally helps me with any caching issues
It's not my browser cache, it's the server-side cache
I've even checked on another pc
<https://www.advancepartners.com/> You can see that there's a phone number on inner pages, but not on the home page
Or at least, if you can't see that I'm even more confused
Huh, checking on a machine outside my network the phone number is there
:confused:
Whatever, I guess it's just me
might be worth deleting the global group from the homepage template and adding it back in. fwiw, iâ€™m not seeing the phone number
Gah
I actually did do that
I also tried making a small change in the page editor and saving
